body: @thammegowda as an FYI here. I see in our https://github.com/USCDataScience/dl4j-kerasimport-examples repo you have linked to several models that we could try and use via Keras import here, including an audio one, and the VGG one e.g., https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/159. I think we should - if https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/issues/3375#issuecomment-299707455 works and if we can add support for VGG and the audio model - include tika-dl in 1.15. It would be a HUGE improvement. I think the code we have currently in this PR for Tika-DL though doesn't need to be specific to Inception - it would work the same with the other models - right?

@chrismattmann Exactly that's the vision for this module - to take full advantage of all those models in all models in https://github.com/fchollet/deep-learning-models/tree/8d8f54a9e1482c3642a55a694c2cde8f26562a06 for audio, video, image, text ....

if we "get DL4J  and keras model importer into tika's class path" AND "make it work ðŸ’¯/ðŸ’¯  on all major platforms like OSX, LINUX and WINDOWS, then we open up huge possibilities of semantic analysis of documents.

I feel it is very difficult to generalize one parser to work for all those models. Each model has its own preprocessing before feeding to the network (we have to apply it on input).
We can easily add parsers later and see the possibilities of generalizing them

Makes sense to me @thammegowda . I am going to try out the audio one today. if I can get that done and if 0.8.1-1 stabilizes my Mac platform, you can test today too on Linux and if all good, let's commit this to Tika 1.15. We won't include it in the standard build yet, we'll just include it as src, then we can keep growing platforms/models and look for a full feature enabled release and binary release as part of 1.16.

@chrismattmann 

>   I am going to try out the audio one today.

If you are referring to [music_tagger_crnn.py](https://github.com/fchollet/deep-learning-models/blob/8d8f54a9e1482c3642a55a694c2cde8f26562a06/music_tagger_crnn.py)

I am afraid that is not drop-in replacement with the Image recognition parser.  
It involves:
1. export `music_tagger_crnn.py` weights as .h5 file, model as .json file
2. create a new parser  in `tika-dl`  to deal with audio mime types
3. and test it

It involves some coding rather than mere testing...! IMHO, it may not be the best use of your time, (we shall let somebody from @USCDataScience raise a new PR, in fact there are lot of students in the community who likes to work on deep learning!)
well let's go then! :) I'll still try and play with it. If 0.8.0-1 passes my tests today, I'm going to commit it, source only. Then follow the plan mentioned above.

Hey folks - 1 question: How are you guys going to handle the nd4j backend for this? I know it's a minor detail but allowing folks to use the gpu for inference would be pretty neat. Maybe what I'm looking at is a "version 2" of this module?  As it is right now nd4j-native-platform will run on every platform (even power and pis!)  but for cuda (which some folks will likely end up using) they'll end up kind of limited.

Great job on seeing this through it's already quite a bit of work.
Users should be able to add the nd4j-cuda-x.x-platform artifact by themselves and it should just work, so it might not be that big of an issue...
I'll put this in this morning.  I want it in Tika 1.15.  Thank you!
Hi @tballison - was about to do this, shall I stop?
Er, please do add it.  Thank you!

Merged in https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/0aaa1215fd11632c349e9bdebac9829578276cb1

Thanks Rafael!
Thanks @agibsonccc  @saudet I am a thinking to deal with GPUs/Cuda in next version. For now  getting CPU backend working stably will do. I like @saudet's suggestion

Guys this is now stable enough to commit with https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/165/commits/704a0393334d2b9911bc19ae458801e7fed7f796. The DL4J guys released a hotfix 0.8.0-2 with the updates they made to stabilize H5 model weights. I ran it 100x it works fine. Tests pass. I'm going to update tika-bundle and include this as a module in tika-parsers and see if that builds fine. If so, imagine, in 1.15, we could have a DL4J REST server (and use in Tika-Python)! awesome (without an external TensorFlow server - which is great/fine, but this reduces complexity). And in 1.16, we have a module to add further recognizers and parsers. This is great!

Awesome.. Happy to see it finally getting into the codebase.

And I will try to get tika+DL4J run on spark / [sparkler](https://github.com/USCDataScience/sparkler) and our crawling teams can use it for focussed crawling on Hadoop/Spark..
OK the last step is now to integrate it into tika-bundle. Wish me luck :/
Actually I'm going to skip integrating into Tika-Bundle. Not sure exactly how and this can be raised in a future PR. Here comes Tika-DL committing now!

@thammegowda let us know when you guys need help. For the inference server, I would recommend our new parallelinference server: https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/blob/master/deeplearning4j-scaleout/deeplearning4j-scaleout-parallelwrapper/src/test/java/org/deeplearning4j/parallelism/ParallelInferenceTest.java#L85 I'll quit pinging you on this PR: More just commenting on your intended roadmap. Let us know if you run in to issues again!
@chrismattmann Thanks.  I see it is now part of tika-app. I am not sure about bundling stuff either.

Thank you for the review @thammegowda. That's simply awesome  :100: I'm using a pretrained model which is not fine tuned. The fine tuned one gives amazing results. If you don't mind  here is the link to krathiGV's finetuned model, 
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=0B3laN3vvvSD2T1RPeDA5djJ6bFE&export=download
move this file to usr/local/models/model_main directory in the container & edit the model_info.xml file accordingly.

We are using the CPU for all the computations here. Still it take less than 1400 ms. If we use Nvidia docker and use GPUs for computations, it takes around 200-400 ms only. That's why I proposed to have two docker versions, one with the GPU version of tensorflow & one with the CPU version of tensorflow. Waiting for the code reviews :1st_place_medal:  
Link to paper,
https://arxiv.org/abs/1411.4555
Hi guys, those results are incredible! Congratulations Thejan, Thamme and Chris!

@ThejanW 

It makes sense. We shall have two dockers, one with CPU only and the other one with GPU.
Agreed, we will have fine-tuned model with the improved performance.

How about doing it in the following order:
1. Integrate the current REST API by developing a java client
2. Upgrade the existing model with a new one with better performance.
3. Create a new docker with GPU support.
Thank you @lfcnassif :1st_place_medal:
Agree with Thamme on the dir paths
Thank you @chrismattmann & @thammegowda for your insightful review :100:. @chrismattmann I will change the model directories as you suggested :+1:

I'm not sure if it'd be easy to do, but if you could come up with a unit test for this (failing on Tika trunk/master, passing with your patch applied), that'd be great to ensure we don't accidentally break it again at some point in the future!

I added a unit test that is able to reproduce the leak. I wouldn't necessarily suggest merging the test into master. It only works (tests anything) on unix systems, it will run on other systems.

As you said the issue is hard to test, being that is caused by the `RAFDataStream` in the FontBox library never being closed and there is no easy was to programmatically see which files the JVM has open.

https://github.com/apache/tika/compare/master...chrismattmann:TIKA-2298

The export statements in bash are not considered by maven.
Thats because the value set in POM.xml overrides those exports.

https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/master/tika-parent/pom.xml#L359
This model requires 3GB and hence the tika-parent should be updated to reflect the same.

Now the question is, to accommodate this VGG model (with unit tests) we need to increase the memory requirements for Tika build system to 3GB.
 Is this okay to do?

@thammegowda I would say it's OK - do you know if there is a Maven plugin to only run tests if a certain amount of RAM is available? I think I could easily hack this using properties, but just checking first.

yes..you are getting an error because you have not pushed the model_info.xml file into Apache repo. I have edited the model_info.xml file in this PR & it has updated directories. Please merge model_info.xml file first, rebuild container and test.

@thammegowda please see the conversation I had with @chrismattmann. When you're rebuilding the container do it with --nocache flag.
`docker build --no-cache=True -f Im2txtRestDockerfile  -t im2txt-rest-tika .`

> Please merge model_info.xml file first, rebuild container and test.

It's complicated!  It's a deadlock - We can't merge until tests pass, and (by the way links are pointing in docker file) tests won't pass until it gets merged. 
For future scenarios like this, please split the changes into two PR's. Updates to `model_info.xml` should be merged first.

Two options I have now:

1. Raise a new PR with the changes to model_info file, merge it first. then it will create conflicts with the current PR. Then ask you to fix it.
OR
2. I take a leap of faith, copy changes you have made to `model_info.xml` to the master branch after basic testing. 

Going with the option 2, (I tested by editing a link to the incoming file in PR, it worked.) I am going to merge this.

[Jenkins at builds.apache.org](https://builds.apache.org/view/T/view/Tika/job/Tika-trunk/1338/org.apache.tika$tika-parsers/console) catched that and it was fixed in a51add2afe475ba8d3fb5847c97f52b1eb71deea by @Gagravarr.

Personally I don't see a reason to add and maintain yet another CI configuration if current works reasonably. I'm closing this for now since "are apparently not covered by the current CI" statement is technically false.

> Jenkins at builds.apache.org catched that and it was fixed in a51add2 by @Gagravarr. > Personally I don't see a reason to add and maintain yet another CI configuration if current works reasonably. I'm closing this for now since "are apparently not covered by the current CI" statement is technically false. OK, I agree. However it's strange that failing builds end up in `master`. I recommend to change the practice and not push or merge into master unless the build is stable (with fast-forward merges and rebasing any pollution of the git history can be avoided).
